St. Louis
St. Louis, the Lucky Lou. When smoke darkened the skies over Pearl Harbor, you emerged unscathed as if blessed by the goddess of fortune. Though subsequent pursuits brought unfavorable outcomes, luck remained by your side. From Guadalcanal to the Philippine Sea, your presence marked numerous battles. Come, survey all with your discerning eye! Let the prosperity of the Eagle Union be known throughout the world.
Luck never stays with one person for too long...
St. Louis uses luxury goods and gold to proclaim the Eagle Union's victories.
When leading the Eagle Union, St. Louis must quickly acquire her unique unit, the "Explorer". This allows St. Louis to rapidly incorporate border resources into cities and improve them. For unwanted resources, the Explorer can remove them and gain substantial yields. Additionally, the Explorer can unlock a tile's potential by creating specific luxury resources. When St. Louis uses Explorers to discover numerous luxury resources within city borders, she can swiftly claim these resources for her territory. Once improved and incorporated into St. Louis's cities, these resources provide [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. With an abundance of luxury resources, St. Louis can establish international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to gain substantial [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism. Thus, the Eagle Union can effortlessly achieve a Culture Victory. [ICON_Culture] 文化值和 [ICON_TradeRoute] 贸易路线容量。而拥有了大量的奢侈品资源，圣路易斯便可通过建立国际 [ICON_TradeRoute] 贸易路线获得大量的 [ICON_Gold] 金币和 [ICON_Tourism] 旅游业绩。届时，白鹰联邦将轻松取得文化胜利。
USS St. Louis (CL-49) was the eighth ship of the Brooklyn-class light cruisers (and the first of the St. Louis subclass) in the United States Navy. She was the fifth U.S. Navy vessel named after the city of St. Louis, Missouri. Construction began on December 10, 1936; she was launched on April 15, 1938, and commissioned on May 19, 1939.
She participated in numerous engagements, including Pearl Harbor, the Aleutian Islands, Guadalcanal, New Georgia, Bougainville, the Battle of the Philippine Sea, Leyte Gulf, air raids on Japan, and the Battle of Okinawa.
Shortly after the war, she was decommissioned on June 20, 1946. In 1951, she was sold to the Brazilian Navy and recommissioned as Tamandaré (C-12), serving until her final decommissioning in 1976.
In 1980, she was sold to Taiwanese shipbreakers for scrapping. On August 24, 1980, while under tow to Taiwan, she took on water and sank near the Cape of Good Hope.
During World War II, she earned eleven battle stars.
Luxury Handle
20% Discount on Purchases with [ICON_Gold] Gold. When consuming [ICON_Gold] Gold, obtain 25% of the [ICON_SesearchPoint] research points of the consumed [ICON_Gold] Gold. The Luxury Resource tiles in this city +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and improved Luxury Resource +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. When creating an international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route, awards 50 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 10 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism (on Standard speed) based on the number of excess copies of Luxury resources St. Louis possesses.
